Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address."},"approveFunds(uint32,uint32)":{"details":"send funds to a Distributor if the conditions are met"},"balanceOf(address)":{"details":"See {IERC20-balanceOf}."},"changeDistributorStatus(uint32,uint32)":{"details":"Allow the donor to change the status of the distributor to either trusted or untrusted.Once set to untrusted it cannot be altered."},"createDistribution(uint32,uint32,uint32,uint8,bool)":{"details":"Create a new distribution - It cannot come from an exiting donor"},"createDistributor(string,string)":{"details":"Create a new distributor - It connot come from the same address as an exiting donor"},"createDonation(string,uint32,uint256,uint8)":{"details":"Create a new Donation. It can only be created by donors"},"createDonor(string)":{"details":"Create a new donor - It connot come from the same address as an exiting distributoramount donated is just a running balance, not an actual account balance"},"decimals()":{"details":"Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation. For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should be displayed to a user as `5.05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`). Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between Ether and Wei. This is the value {ERC20} uses, unless this function is overridden; NOTE: This information is only used for _display_ purposes: it in no way affects any of the arithmetic of the contract, including {IERC20-balanceOf} and {IERC20-transfer}."},"decreaseAllowance(address,uint256)":{"details":"Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least `subtractedValue`."},"distributorWithdrawal(uint256)":{"details":"Allow the distributor to withdraw funds balance"},"donorWithdrawal(uint256,uint32)":{"details":"Allow the donor to withdraw funds balance provided there are no distributions that have submitted funding requests"},"getAllDonorBalances(uint32)":{"details":"Get the balances of the donor ; i.e. all summarise all donations made by this donor","returns":{"donatedAmount":" Total Donated Amount","fundsAvailableToWithdraw":"Funds available to withdraw","grantedAmount":"Distributed Amount - funds actually sent to distributor","requestedNotGranted":"Requested amount but not approved"}},"getDonationBalance(uint32)":{"details":"Get the balances of a specific donation : Used by the distributor to check what funds are available","returns":{"donatedAmount":"donatedAmount","grantedAmount":"Distributed Amount - funds actually sent to distributor","requestedNotGranted":"Requested amount but not approved"}},"increaseAllowance(address,uint256)":{"details":"Atomically increases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address."},"makeDonation(uint256,uint32,uint32)":{"details":"Allow the donor to ring fence funds for a donation. No actual transfer of funds."},"name()":{"details":"Returns the name of the token."},"owner()":{"details":"Returns the address of the current owner."},"paused()":{"details":"Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise."},"renounceOwnership()":{"details":"Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner."},"symbol()":{"details":"Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name."},"totalSupply()":{"details":"See {IERC20-totalSupply}."},"transfer(address,uint256)":{"details":"See {IERC20-transfer}. Requirements: - `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - the caller must have a balance of at least `amount`."},"transferFrom(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"See {IERC20-transferFrom}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. This is not required by the EIP. See the note at the beginning of {ERC20}. Requirements: - `sender` and `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - `sender` must have a balance of at least `amount`. - the caller must have allowance for ``sender``'s tokens of at least `amount`."},"transferOwnership(address)":{"details":"Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner."}},"stateVariables":{"distributionCount":{"details":"Disrtibutions"},"distributorCount":{"details":"Distributors"},"donationCount":{"details":"Donations"},"donations":{"details":"Using arrays rather than mappings where I need to iterate over the contents"},"donorCount":{"details":"Donors"}},"version":1},"userdoc":{"kind":"user","methods":{"approveFunds(uint32,uint32)":{"notice":"if successful Update the amount granted on the donation and reduce the amount requested"},"createDistribution(uint32,uint32,uint32,uint8,bool)":{"notice":"Requires that The donor list is verified - verification of lists to happen outside on IPFS - not approve(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-approve}. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

approveFunds(uint32,uint32).details: send funds to a Distributor if the conditions are met

changeDistributorStatus(uint32,uint32).details: Allow the donor to change the status of the distributor to either trusted or untrusted.Once set to untrusted it cannot be altered.

createDistribution(uint32,uint32,uint32,.details: Create a new distribution - It cannot come from an exiting donor

createDistributor(string,string).details: Create a new distributor - It connot come from the same address as an exiting donor

createDonation(string,uint32,uint256,uin.details: Create a new Donation. It can only be created by donors

createDonor(string).details: Create a new donor - It connot come from the same address as an exiting distributoramount donated is just a running balance, not an actual account balance

decimals().details: Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation. For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should be displayed to a user as `5.05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`). Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between Ether and Wei. This is the value {ERC20} uses, unless this function is overridden; NOTE: This information is only used for _display_ purposes: it in no way affects any of the arithmetic of the contract, including {IERC20-balanceOf} and {IERC20-transfer}.

decreaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least `subtractedValue`.

distributorWithdrawal(uint256).details: Allow the distributor to withdraw funds balance

donorWithdrawal(uint256,uint32).details: Allow the donor to withdraw funds balance provided there are no distributions that have submitted funding requests

getAllDonorBalances(uint32).details: Get the balances of the donor ; i.e. all summarise all donations made by this donor

returns.grantedAmount: Distributed Amount - funds actually sent to distributor

getDonationBalance(uint32).details: Get the balances of a specific donation : Used by the distributor to check what funds are available

returns.grantedAmount: Distributed Amount - funds actually sent to distributor

increaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically increases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

makeDonation(uint256,uint32,uint32).details: Allow the donor to ring fence funds for a donation. No actual transfer of funds.

name().details: Returns the name of the token.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

symbol().details: Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name.

transfer(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transfer}. Requirements: - `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - the caller must have a balance of at least `amount`.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transferFrom}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. This is not required by the EIP. See the note at the beginning of {ERC20}. Requirements: - `sender` and `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - `sender` must have a balance of at least `amount`. - the caller must have allowance for ``sender``'s tokens of at least `amount`.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

donations.details: Using arrays rather than mappings where I need to iterate over the contents

approveFunds(uint32,uint32).notice: if successful Update the amount granted on the donation and reduce the amount requested

createDistribution(uint32,uint32,uint32,.notice: Requires that The donor list is verified - verification of lists to happen outside on IPFS - not implemented
